alert.note: Alert for Central and Southeast Phillips; Petroleum; Southwest Phillips (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 4:20PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Phillips and northern Petroleum Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 419 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 20 miles west of Fourchette, or 21 miles south of Zortman, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fourchette. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
